prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(reshape2)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Convert count table to matrix format
count_matrix <- as.matrix(count_table[, -1]) # Exclude the first column

# Read annotation data
annot_data <- read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, sep = "\t")

# Get group names from annotation data
groups <- unique(annot_data$group)

# Create a list to store group-specific genes
group_specific_genes <- list()

# Perform statistical test for each group
for (group in groups) {
  # Get sample ids for the current group
  sample_ids <- annot_data$sample_id[annot_data$group == group]
  
  # Select count matrix for the current group
  group_count_matrix <- count_matrix[, colnames(count_matrix) %in% sample_ids]
  
  # Convert count matrix to DESeqDataSet format
  dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = group_count_matrix,
                                colData = data.frame(sample = colnames(group_count_matrix)),
                                design = ~ sample)
  
  # Perform differential expression analysis
  dds <- DESeq(dds)
  
  # Find significantly differentially expressed genes
  res <- results(dds)
  group_specific_genes[[group]] <- rownames(res[res$padj < 0.05 & abs(res$log2FoldChange) > 1, ])
}

# Combine genes specific for each group
combined_specific_genes <- do.call(c, group_specific_genes)

# Filter count matrix to keep only group-specific genes
filtered_count_matrix <- count_matrix[row.names(count_matrix) %in% combined_specific_genes, ]

# Perform PCA on the filtered count matrix
pca <- prcomp(t(filtered_count_matrix))

# Create data frame for PCA results
pca_data <- data.frame(PC1 = pca$x[, 1], PC2 = pca$x[, 2], group = annot_data$group)

# Plot PCA with color-coded groups
ggplot(pca_data, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal()
```
